meanings.definition: In a manner that relates to or serves as a memorial.
meanings.sent1: She spoke memorially at the ceremony, honoring those who had passed away.
meanings.sent2: The statue was placed memorially in the park to remember the fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent3: The children played memorially, pretending to be historical figures from the past.
meanings.sent4: The old photographs were displayed memorially, capturing moments frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The music played memorially, evoking memories of loved ones no longer here.

meanings.definition: In a way that commemorates or honors the memory of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The community gathered memorially to pay respects to the late mayor.
meanings.sent2: The memorial was built memorially to honor the victims of the tragedy.
meanings.sent3: The students sang memorially, remembering their favorite teacher who retired.
meanings.sent4: The painting was created memorially, capturing the essence of a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The candles flickered memorially, casting a warm glow on the photographs of lost loved ones.
